document.masterDocTitle: A review of the genus Kiwaia Philpott, 1930 (Lepidoptera, Gelechiidae) in the Palaearctic Region

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the genus Kiwaia Philpott, 1930 (Lepidoptera, Gelechiidae) in the Palaearctic Region

heading.emphasis:
Key to the male genitalia of Palaearctic
Kiwaia-
species

subSubSection.paragraph:
(The male of
K . ( E .) yadongensis
sp. n.
is unknown)

paragraph.keyLead:
1 . Phallus about as long as tegumen and uncus, with rounded apex and short lateral tooth, saccus 3 times longer than basal width (
Figs 52, 53
)............................................................................
K. ( E. ) ramulata

2 . Ventral margin of valva with short process (
Figs 45, 46
)....................................
K. ( E. ) montana
sp. n.

3 . Saccus twice broader than valva in middle, about half of its length (
Fig. 47
)......................
K. ( E. ) medogia
sp. n.
- Saccus as broad as valva in middle or narower, shorter than half length of valva................................... 4

4 . Uncus twice longer than broad on 1 / 4 length, posterior margin with medail incision (
Fig. 44
).............
K. ( E. ) spinosa
- Uncus less than twice longer than broad on 1 / 4 length, posterior margin rounded.................................. 5

6 . Sacculus narrow, saccus broad, apical thorn long (
Fig 48
).........................................
K. ( E. ) kumatai

- Sacculus broad, saccus narrow, apical thorn short (
Figs 49–51
)...............................
K. ( E. ) povolnyi
sp. n.

7 . Saccus broad, extended far beyond top of pedunculus, phallus stout, broad (
Fig. 38
)...........
K. ( E. ) nyingchiensis
sp. n.
- Saccus narrower, slightly exceeds beyond top of pedunculus, phallus slender..................................... 8

8 . Sacculus about as long as vincular process (
Figs 42, 43
).....................................
K. ( E .) centrica
sp. n.

10 . Phallus with crescentic cornutus, sacculus broadened apically (
Figs 39–41
).................
K. ( E. ) septentrionala
sp. n.
- Phallus without crescentic cornutus, sacculus pointed apically................................................ 11

11 . Phallus comparatively narrow, valva extending to about half length of uncus (
Figs 29–31
).............
K. ( E. ) palaearctica
- Phallus comparatively broad, valva extending to the top of uncus............................................. 12

12 . Apical arm of phallus with postrior margin broadly rounded, valva apically rounded (
Fig. 28
)............
K. ( E. ) dryosyrta

- Apical arm of phallus with postrior margin concave in middle, valva apically pointed (
Fig. 32
).....
K. ( E. ) mengdana
sp. n.
